summary: The following are notable people who were either born, raised or have lived for a significant period of time in the U.S.
full_text:
Denton County is a county in the U.S. state of Texas. As of the 2010 census, its population was 662,614, making it the ninth-most populous county in Texas. The county seat is Denton. The county, which was named for John B. Denton, was established in 1846.
Denton County is included in the Dallas-Fort Worth-Arlington, TX Metropolitan Statistical Area. In 2007, it was one of the fastest-growing counties in the United States.
^ Quickfacts 2012.
^ Naco 2011.
^ Census 2007.
title: Denton County, Texas
